definition: a blood soaked and hard-fought struggle (idiom)

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Benitez admits he is anticipating a tough encounter against Unirea in Bucharest.
sentences.chinese: 同時，貝尼特斯承認他預料在布加勒斯特是一場苦戰。

sentences.english: After days of hard work, the culvert was at last completed.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾天的苦戰，高低把涵洞修好了。

sentences.english: They conquered the flood after a strenuous fight lasting four days and four nights.
sentences.chinese: 經過四天四夜的苦戰他們終於戰勝了洪水。

sentences.english: Villages have always worked hard to fight the main force is the poor peasant.
sentences.chinese: 鄉村中一向苦戰奮鬥的主要力量是貧農。

sentences.english: He predicted a bitter fight in the coming weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他預測接下去幾周裏會有一場苦戰。

definition: to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
Salt Lake City, capital of Utah
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to fight with all one's might
